intro: Dendrolobium cumingianum, commonly known as the Cuming's wattled legume, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its typical pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant is shrub-like, with compound leaves and yellow to orange flowers that bloom in summer. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of local flora and a subject of ecological study.
